synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, the hosts engage in a heartfelt conversation with Valante, a talented music producer and teacher, who shares his journey of overcoming personal struggles and finding inspiration in lifeâ€™s experiences. The episode beautifully explores themes of creativity, self-acceptance, and the importance of connection, making it a truly uplifting listen.
quotes: I just want to like set the record straight. I'm not a professor. I'm a teacher. But, you know, just a professor sounds so damn fancy.
I was looking for representation. I just needed to feel like I wasn't alone in the pain of it all.
Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
I used to think that artists or creative people who said stuff like, 'Oh, I don't know where it comes from,' were cringe, but I am one of those people now.
You can really change the world in small ways, I believe.
I always say there's such a fine line between survivor's guilt and a savior complex.
Is there a law which guarantees you a certain amount of weeks of vacation every year? In America, it depends on the company.
I think it's really brave to decide to leave your job and throw yourself into the unknown.
You can just lay on the bed and be like, 'Why doesn't everybody just lay on the bed? This is the greatest thing ever.'
If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
